channel.title: RevengePK's RSPS History
channel.description:
I was reading through all of the ones others have posted and they were really interesting, so I decided I'd let everyone know a little about my history. :D
Soooooo, I started playing RSPS in about 2010 and didn't join MSCP until 2011. The first server I ever played was a server called "Pk-Era". I can't find any screenshots of it but I did find a very poorly editted PK video. I think it was this day that I started playing RSPS that I lost all interest in RuneScape. (I was about 18 when I started playing RSPS).
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KfHV9fp13_k[/youtube]
From there I started playing a server called "ZigiScape" that I later worked my way from moderator to owning the server. (Main owner, not co-owner) This server achieved about 200 players online. Below is a video of that server.
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1LSPZx77008[/youtube]
ZigiScape soon shutdown because I didn't know what I was doing (I still don't.) From there I started my first "Real" server which was named "Divinex" which ultimately failed an got a max of about 30 onlines, from there I started the server "RevengePK" which also failed but got about 100 online. After that I went go into Web Design and started releasing simple TOS pages on MoparScape for people to use on their sites. This was kind of a hit, people used my stuff, but nothing big so I decided to start another server called "ForgivenX". This server was online for about a year and fluctuated a player base of about 50 online to 300 online at times. Ultimately the server went offline due to a paypal debt of $500-+ (chargebacks). From there I decided I was really done with RSPS, I lost money, I love the communities that come with owning an RSPS but the money losses out weighed that. It was this moment that I decided to touch back on Web development.
I started RSPSDesigns sometime in 2012 and started making website templates and released them for free. It was a hit kind of but really didn't take off so I shut it down for awhile. In early/mid 2013 I decided to open RSPSDesigns back up and amounted probably a total collective count of members and posts of 10k posts and 1k-+ members, but due to database problems and me just messing things up I lost most data and hit some bumps in the road. Once I got RSPSDesigns stable (late 2013) it was getting 400 uniques a day, many downloads, but absolutely no income, no donations, no thanks, just spam from kids just leeching the templates. So coming into 2014 I've taken down RSPSDesigns again and I don't think I will be opening it. My templates still float around the RSPS communities but you will most likely not see my name on them because people have stolen my work.
Atleast I made a name for myself. :D
From there I think I'm done with RSPS as a whole but I won't leave MoparScape because I like the community although my activity is not that high.

item.title: RevengePK's RSPS History
item.dc:creator: @firstchoice8 firstchoice8
item.description:
@firstchoice8 wrote:

Now that I look at zigiscape, it wasn’t that great of a server, but it sure has tons of memories good and bad. (mostly good) I remember when you got mod and almost all the old staff members from v1 hated you.

Edit: I think the reason it was so fun was because the community was amazing.

Read full topic

item.title: RevengePK's RSPS History

item.description:
@Sessy_Pk3r wrote:

Sucks. Releasing for free was probably your biggest mistake in monetary terms.

Read full topic

@RevengePK wrote:

I was reading through all of the ones others have posted and they were really interesting, so I decided I’d let everyone know a little about my history.
